text: Aabeni was an ancient Egyptian official with the title high steward. He was one of the most important officials at the royal court in the early Thirteenth Dynasty. ==Attestation== Aabeni is known from a number of monuments. ===Papyrus Boulaq 18=== His most important attestation is in the Papyrus Boulaq 18.Wolfram Grajetzki: Court Officials of the Egyptian Middle Kingdom, London 2009 p. 77 This papyrus is an account of the Theban palace dating to the Thirteenth Dynasty where he appears in several lists of officials. The exact dating of Papyrus Boulaq 18 is dispute in Egyptology,K.S.B. Ryholt, The Political Situation in Egypt during the Second Intermediate Period (Carsten Niebuhr Institute Publications, vol. 20. Copenhagen: Museum Tusculanum Press, 1997), p. 319 therefore it remains open under which king Aabni served, but in the papyrus also appears the vizier Ankhu. ===Abydos=== At Abydos, Aabeni is also known from a weight found and a stela. == References == Category:Officials of the Thirteenth Dynasty of Egypt Category:Ancient Egyptian high stewards
title: Aabeni
